snippet: Dozens were killed in Allende amid a drug gang’s feud, according to an activist’s account, which also raised questions about American involvement....
abstract: Study conducted by human rights activist Sergio Aguayo finds that Mexican officials ignored 2011 massacre of 42 people in town of Allende by Zetas, Mexico's most feared drug cartel; investigation was only conducted after reports began to surface in news media three years later.
lead_paragraph: Dozens were killed in Allende amid a drug gang’s feud, according to an activist’s account, which also raised questions about American involvement.

headline.main: Report Criticizes Mexican Officials for Ignoring 2011 Massacre
headline.print_headline: Mexican Officials Ignored 2011 Massacre, Report Says
